marg LOCAL marg

NAME

mjo_arg_print — print a formatted list of options

SYNOPSIS

#include <marg.h>

void
mjo_arg_print(FILE *const io_write, const mjo_arg_t i_arg);

DESCRIPTION

Prints all of the options in a user friendly format. Typically, this is invoked when a user specifies the help option on the command line.

Following is a description of the arguments.

io_write
stream to write too
io_arg
pointer to a ‘mjo_arg_t’ of the options that shall be printed

If io_write is nil, output is sent to stdout.

If i_arg is nil or the container is empty, the following message will be printed

This application does not have any options

NOTES

If a programming error is encountered, diagnostics shall be ouput to stderr

A programming error may occur if an internal attribute is not recoginized. Internal attributes start with a period such as mjo_arg_option_internal_operand_str.

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
